conclusion: Analyze the displacement-time graph to determine how many times the speed is 5 m/s from t = 0 to t = 4 s.
Speed is the absolute value of velocity; velocity is the derivative of displacement with respect to time.
The slope of the tangent line to the curve at any point gives the instantaneous velocity.
Find points where the magnitude of the slope is 5 m/s.
Two specific points on the graph where the slope of the tangent line appears to have an absolute value of 5 m/s.
In Image 2, the tangent line at a point on the curve has a slope of approximately 5 m/s.
In Image 3, another tangent line at a different point on the curve has a slope of approximately 5 m/s.
There are two distinct points on the curve where the speed is 5 m/s.
Final answer: There are 2 moments when the speed is 5 m/s.
